sentence.Network_en: In spite of her hostility, she was attracted to him.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管自己心存敌意，她还是为他所吸引。

sentence.Network_en: The blunt comment made Richard laugh in spite of himself.
sentence.Network_cn: 这番率直的话让理查德不由自主地大笑起来。

sentence.Network_en: I wouldn't trust them in spite of all their la-di-da manners.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管他们处处显得很高雅的样子，我还是不相信他们。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 达克莱伊_百度百科 ... 打鼾 Snore 怨恨（spite） Spite 最终保留 Last Resort.
大学英语六级词汇表_大学六级 ... spiral n． 螺旋，螺线 spite n． 怨恨，恶意 splash vi． 飞溅.
He slept well in spite of the noise ., 尽管吵得很 , 他睡得很好.
新概念英语第二册单词总汇_英语网 ... famous a. 著名的，极好的 spite n. 恶意，恨，遗恨 fan n. 戏迷，狂热爱好者.

list.abs: His spiteful remark revealed his true self ., 他恶意的言词揭露出他真实的自我.
Walter ' s spiteful remarks were quite uncalled for ., 沃尔特恶意的话完全是多余的.
it was spiteful of her to do that .她那样做是怀有恶意的。
He made a spiteful comment ., 他发表了恶意的评论.

jx.jx_en_mean: although one did not want or expect to do so

lj.lj_ly: Oliver smiled in spite of himself.
lj.lj_ls: 奥利弗不由自主地笑了笑。

lj.lj_ly: They kept going in spite of their fears.
lj.lj_ls: 他们不顾害怕继续前进

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: shortening of Old French despit 'contempt', despiter 'show contempt for'

entry.def: You use in spite of to introduce a fact which makes the rest of the statement you are making seem surprising.

example.ex: Josef Krips at the State Opera hired her in spite of the fact that she had never sung on stage...
example.tran: 尽管她从未在舞台上演唱过，国家歌剧院的约瑟夫·克里普斯还是聘用了她。

example.ex: Their love of life comes in spite of, almost in defiance of, considerable hardship.
example.tran: 尽管面临众多的艰难困苦，他们还是几乎义无反顾地表现出了对生活的热爱。

entry.def: If you do something in spite of yourself, you do it although you did not really intend to or expect to.

example.ex: The blunt comment made Richard laugh in spite of himself...
example.tran: 这番率直的话让理查德不由自主地大笑起来。

example.ex: She was deeply moved and in spite of herself could not help showing it.
example.tran: 她被深深地打动了，禁不住为之动容。

entry.def: If you do something cruel out of spite, you do it because you want to hurt or upset someone.

example.ex: I refused her a divorce, out of spite I suppose...
example.tran: 我拒绝和她离婚，就是为了出口恶气。

example.ex: Never had she met such spite and pettiness.
example.tran: 她从未见过这样的怨恨和偏狭。

entry.def: If you do something cruel to spite someone, you do it in order to hurt or upset them.

example.ex: Pantelaras was giving his art collection away for nothing, to spite Marie and her husband.
example.tran: 潘特拉拉斯将自己的艺术藏品全都无偿捐了出去，存心要激怒玛丽和她的丈夫。

means.word_mean: 1. feeling a need to see others suffer
2. malevolence by virtue of being malicious or spiteful or nasty

sentences.sentence: "She hurt me when she did not include me among her guests"

sentences.en: The boy has a spite against me.
